conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet to the containers.
Inlet A: Liquid flows from top left, moving downward and slightly to the right, passing through blue and gray baffles towards the center.
Inlet B: Liquid flows from top center, moving downward, passing through gray baffle towards the center.
Inlet C: Liquid flows from top right, moving downward and slightly to the left, passing through yellow and gray baffles towards the center.
Inlet D: Liquid flows from top right, moving downward, passing through green baffle towards the center.
All inlets direct the liquid towards the center of the system where it will converge.
Baffles are arranged to direct liquid towards the center where it will accumulate before flowing into containers.
Container E will receive liquid from the left side of the central area.
Container F will receive liquid from the right side of the central area.
Liquid will be evenly distributed between containers E and F, depending on system symmetry and flow rate.
Final Answer: Liquid will flow into both containers E and F, with an even distribution assuming symmetry.
